channel.title: Adding rights to object teleport[PI]

item.title: Adding rights to object teleport[PI]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:541523”][quote author=Kozs link=topic=660393.msg4415614#msg4415614 date=1395779322]
Now let me explain how this works…

If whatever happens in the parentheses is true then the statement will happen } else { will be if it’s not right

So

       if (c.objectX == 1243 && c.objectY == 2997) {

Saying if object is there then it’ll initiate the teleport. Now, if you want it to work for Admins only… Do this

This is saying if you’re Admin ONLY… If you wanted it to be Admin and up

Hope I helped.

  • Kozs

[/quote]
Ew, can you at least make it a bit more formatted…

if ( (c.objectX == 1243 && c.objectY == 2997) && c.playerRights == 2) {

Since c.objectX and c.objectY are related to each other, they should be checked together. Basically, instead of checking all three variables separately, this checks if objectX and objectY are both right, and then checks the player rights. It honestly makes little to no difference, but is good practice if you ever need to use or instead of and.

You should of also just explained what the operators are instead of making different snippets for them.

[code]
&& and
|| or
== equal to

= greater than or equal to
<= less than or equal to
< less than
greater than
[/code][/quote]There shouldn’t be a space between the if ( and the next bracket. As stated before it looks stupid, a function could be better.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:3, topic:541523”]Now let me explain how this works…

If whatever happens in the parentheses is true then the statement will happen } else { will be if it’s not right

So

       if (c.objectX == 1243 && c.objectY == 2997) {

Saying if object is there then it’ll initiate the teleport. Now, if you want it to work for Admins only… Do this

This is saying if you’re Admin ONLY… If you wanted it to be Admin and up

Hope I helped.

  • Kozs[/quote]
    Ew, can you at least make it a bit more formatted…
if ( (c.objectX == 1243 && c.objectY == 2997) && c.playerRights == 2) {

Since c.objectX and c.objectY are related to each other, they should be checked together. Basically, instead of checking all three variables separately, this checks if objectX and objectY are both right, and then checks the player rights. It honestly makes little to no difference, but is good practice if you ever need to use or instead of and.

You should of also just explained what the operators are instead of making different snippets for them.

&& and
|| or
== equal to
>= greater than or equal to
<= less than or equal to
< less than
> greater than

Read full topic
